channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipped rubish, 21st December
item.description:
Four black bags of fly tipped rubbish on the edge of the woods at the side of the road opposite where the new fencing has been erected in the slip road leading to Bursted Woods Surgery.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike stand outside Fitness First gym, 21st December
item.description:
Three discarded bike locks attached to the bike stand. They have been there for two months at least.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food Waste Bins accumulating, 21st December
item.description:
I reported this before and had an e-mail saying it had been sorted so case closed, the waste bins are still there though. There's a small pile by the vicarage gates - no one's using them / claimed them. Can someone collect them for recycling please? Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sandringham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recently filled in hole round drain has all cracked, 21st December
item.description:
Hole round the drain was not long ago filled badly and now has all cracked and fallen in with a large deep in the road now outside my property needs to be filled properly so doesnâ€™t happen again !

item.title: Rubbish fly tipped by wall/bins, 21st December
item.description:
Rubbish has been there for months with no sign of clearing. Only more litter being added. Rats and foxes seen regularly around the area. Very unsightly and hazardous to children and pets.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birkdale Close, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Disgraceful Abandoned Construction not done, 21st December
item.description:
Absolutely disgraceful construction just a abandoned for months and Greenwich council don't care You can see clearly it's half done It's actually very unsafe socially and when using the stairs one can slip and break their back easily Please do something Greenwich council

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pettman Crescent, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet
